documents.body:
# Contract for { service } ## { provider_name } | { client_name } ----- ## Introduction { provider_name } (“{ provider_title }”) will provide { client_name } (“{ client_title }”) with { service } (“Services”), as described in this document. *Contract in effect beginning*: **{ date }** (or earliest date signed by both parties) #### { provider_title } - { provider_name } - { provider_address } - [{ provider_email }](mailto:{ provider_email }) - { provider_phone } #### { client_title } - { client_name } - [{ client_email }](mailto:{ client_email }) - { client_phone } ----- ## Scope of Work #### Project Milestones These milestones will serve as anchor points against which project progress will be measured. 1. A { service } direction is selected by the { client_title } from the options available 2. The { provider_title } presents initial proof(s) to the { client_title } 3. The { client_title } provides feedback on initial proof(s) 4. The { provider_title } makes necessary revisions 5. The { client_title } accepts the work as complete #### Deliverables Services will be provided to the { client_title } in the form of: - Research related to the { client_title }’s needs - Working files of the { service } - Applicable supporting materials The { provider_title } reserves the right to withhold one or more of these components until the end of the { service } process but may choose not to. #### Standards for Delivery The { provider_title } will provide the { client_title } with each of the deliverables via an agreed-upon method. The { client_title } acknowledges that the { provider_title } will be held to a high standard of work, but that these standards are ultimately defined by the { provider_title }. If the { provider_title } refuses to deliver the services in accordance with this contract, the { client_title } may claim negligence on the part of the { provider_title } and request legally binding arbitration. #### Amendments & Changes This contract may be amended as necessary in case of changes to the scope of work. In such cases, both parties will agree on new terms, an amendment will be added to the contract, and both parties will sign the agreed-upon amendment. See [Changes & Disputes](#changes-disputes). #### Acceptance/Rejection of Services Acceptance of provided Services will be constituted by an affirmative statement of acceptance by the { client_title }. The { provider_title } reserves the right to consider the { service } as accepted if it is not rejected after five (5) business days. ----- ## Payment - The { provider_title } will invoice the { client_title } for 50% of the agreed-upon price for the Services within ten (10) business days of the first engagement. - The invoice for the remaining 50% will be sent within ten (10) business days of the { client_title }'s acceptance of the work. - If the scope of work changes during the project, the { provider_title } will invoice the { client_title } for any additional fees within ten (10) business days of the change. #### Billing/Invoices The { provider_title } will bill the { client_title } via PDF invoice, sent to the { client_title }’s given email address as an attachment. If the { provider_title } does not receive payment within fifteen (15) business days via the agreed-upon method of payment, the { client_title } will incur a late fee of ten percent (10%) of the invoiced amount. An additional late fee of ten percent (10%) will be added for every additional ten (10) business days elapsed. The { provider_title } reserves the right to waive one or more late fees under special circumstances. #### Payment Options The { client_title } and { provider_title } will work to establish a mutally acceptable method of payment. #### Termination The { client_title } may terminate the project at any point in time, provided all invoices have been paid in full. #### Alternate Rates & Fees The { provider_title } may charge the { client_title } an alternate rate or fee for services beyond the original scope of the project or expedited work. The { provider_title } will provide written notice and an amendment to this contract with the relevant details. (see [Scope of Work](#scope-of-work)). The { client_title } will not be billed for any amount greater than the amount specified in this contract and its amendments. #### Relationship The relationship between the { provider_title } and the { client_title } is an independent contractor relationship and is not an employer/employee relationship, a joint venture, co-ownership, agency, or partnership. ----- ## Ownership All original designs produced by the { provider_title } during the project are protected under United States Copyright Law (Title 17). > “The property right in a design subject to protection under this chapter shall vest in the designer, the legal representatives of a deceased designer or of one under legal incapacity, the employer for whom the designer created the design in the case of a design made within the regular scope of the designer’s employment, or a person to whom the rights of the designer or of such employer have been transferred. The person in whom the property right is vested shall be considered the owner of the design.” > (17 U.S.C. § 1320a, 2016) #### Ownership Transfer Upon completion of the project, after final payment has been received, intellectual property rights and ownership of the final { service } will be surrendered from the { provider_title } to the { client_title }. The { provider_title } retains ownership and intellectual property rights of all rejected work. The { provider_title } is not obligated to provide copies of rejected work to the { client_title } after the project is completed. This contract will function as the instrument in writing to facilitate the transfer, as specified in 17 U.S.C. 1320b, 2016. Upon completion of the project and subsequent transfer of ownership, the { provider_title } is absolved of all responsibility for potential infringement on the intellectual property of other individuals or groups. By signing this contract and accepting full ownership of the work produced, the { client_title } accepts all responsibility for such potential infringements. #### Restrictions on Use The { provider_title } retains non-exclusive rights to personal and indirect commercial use of work produced for the { client_title }. This includes publication on the { provider_title }’s website(s), portfolio, social media accounts, and marketing materials. This also includes the use and reuse of general solutions for common problems developed during the project. This provision excludes direct commercial use, resale, or distribution of the work, for which the { provider_title } does not reserve any rights. #### Attribution The { client_title } may attribute the work to the { provider_title } (e.g. “Our { service } was provided by { provider_name }”), however the { provider_title } reserves the right to request attribution be removed. #### Modification of Work As the { client_title } is the full owner of the work after the project is complete, they may modify the work as necessary to suit their needs. The { client_title } reserves the right to use the modified work freely, however the { provider_title } must be given opportunity to accept or forfeit attribution. ----- ## Changes & Disputes Any change to this contract may be made once the { client_title } and the { provider_title } provide written acknowledgment of the change. Any change to this document requires the signature of both parties. Resolution to disputes will be sought via legally binding arbitration under applicable US federal law and the laws of the State of { state }. In the event of termination, the { provider_title } retains full ownership of all work created within the scope of this contract. #### Notice of Termination In the event that the { client_title } terminates the project, the { client_title } must provide the { provider_title } with a written notice of termination and pay any outstanding invoices within ten (10) business days. See [Termination](#termination). #### Refunds In the event that the { provider_title } terminates the project, the { provider_title } will provide the { client_title } with a written notice of termination and refund the full amount to the { client_title }. #### Emergencies In the event of a personal health emergency or national emergency, legally binding arbitration may be sought ninety (90) days after the date of the last invoice billed. ----- ## Project Agreement The { client_title } and { provider_title } agree that the { client_title } will pay the { provider_title } { price } via an agreed-upon payment method for the Service of { service }, delivered as specified in this contract. The { provider_title } cannot be held liable to the { client_title } or any third-party for damages, including lost profits, lost savings or other incidental, consequential or special damages. If any provision of this contract is unlawful, void, or for any reason unenforceable, then that provision will be deemed severable from this contract and will not affect the validity and enforceability of any remaining provisions. #### The { client_title } agrees to the terms and conditions specified in this document: > Signature:
> Printed Name: { client_name }
> Date: #### Accepted by the { provider_title }: > Signature:
> Printed Name: { provider_name }
> Date: { date }
